alert.note: Alert for Logan; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:10PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wallace and northwestern Logan Counties through 545 PM MDT/645 PM CDT/... At 509 PM MDT/609 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles north of Wallace, or 11 miles northeast of Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Wallace and northwestern Logan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT/900 PM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
